body: PICKMAN--Morton "Mac", 98, died on December 22, 2011 peacefully at home with his beloved wife of 39 years, Gladys, by his side. He will be remembered for his generous spirit, sharp wit, and keen business acumen. Morton Pickman was born on December 5, 1913. He grew up in Manhattan Beach, Brooklyn and obtained degrees from New York University School
title: Paid Notice: Deaths PICKMAN, MORTON "MAC"

body: A day after former State Senator Carl Kruger tearfully pleaded guilty to corruption charges, the campaigning to replace him began on Wednesday, with Republicans hoping for a rare victory in New York City and Democrats eager to hold the seat. The state's top elected Republican, Dean G. Skelos of Long Island, the Senate majority leader, and dozens of
title: G.O.P. Is Hopeful as Race to Replace Senator Takes Shape

body: THE girls are so little that some still have round toddler bellies. But their faces are grave and focused during ballet lessons in the storied Vaganova tradition, imported to Brooklyn, along with most of the teachers, from Russia. At the Brighton Ballet Theater School of Russian Ballet, most of the 400 students are children and grandchildren of
title: Russian Ballet, Brooklyn Flavor

body: In the hallways and classrooms of Public School 225 in Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, Carolina Martinez is something of a celebrity. Students can be heard vying for her attention -- ''Ms. Carolina! Ms. Carolina!'' -- and often greet her with hugs. Ms. Martinez, 32, is the parent outreach coordinator in the afterschool program at the Shorefront YM-YWHA
title: THE NEEDIEST CASES; A Giver to the Community Learns to Accept Its Help

author: E-mail: dwyer@nytimes.com; Twitter: @jimdwyernyt
body: For the last few years, Richard Powell, a young man who saw himself as ''alone in the world,'' has marked Thanksgiving with a slice of pizza. The day after, he would go back to work at one of his jobs, at Burger King, the American Museum of Natural History or the Frick Collection. This year, though, he was up early Tuesday and helping prepare 800
title: ABOUT NEW YORK; At Rikers, Roasting Turkeys for a New Start

body: 'AKC MEET THE BREEDS' The setup may remind you of speed dating or a matchmaking service. But here, at least, you can expect lifelong commitment. Not to mention unconditional love. Those aren't empty promises at ''AKC Meet the Breeds,'' the annual event to help families get acquainted with prospective companions of the furry, four-legged variety.
title: Spare Times: For Children

body: When Olga and Alexander Vartsaba won the green card lottery and moved from Russia to the United States in 2002, they believed their luck had finally changed. What they never expected was to be living nine years later in an apartment in Coney Island, Brooklyn, with no furniture -- not even beds for their three young children. The Vartsabas have had
title: THE NEEDIEST CASES; Giving Their Children a Place to Lay Their Heads

body: LIBO--Andrew L.,54, of Mamaroneck, NY died peacefully at home on October 25, 2011 surrounded by family and friends. Born on October 6, 1957 to Dr. Hersh and Libby Libo, Andrew grew up in Manhattan Beach, Brooklyn. He attended Poly Prep Country Day School where he was a star wrestler and from where he graduated in 1975. Andrew graduated cum laude
title: Paid Notice: Deaths LIBO, ANDREW L.

body: Ana Ramirez, 35, of Coney Island swung her metal detector over the sand just off the Coney Island Boardwalk in the shadow of the Wonder Wheel ride. -''People say that storms sweep a lot of sand away, so it's a good time to look for things on the beach,'' Ms. Ramirez said as she walked on the beach a few days after Tropical Storm Irene lashed the
title: For Beachcombers, The Tropical Storm Whipped Up Hopes

body: Congratulations to Dan Savage and his mantra ''Good, Giving and Game.'' And thanks to Mark Oppenheimer for bringing it beyond the alternative weeklies to a wider audience of mainstream, heterosexual couples (''Married, With Infidelities''). Honest communication with your partner surely is something to strive for in a long-term relationship,
title: REPLY ALL | LETTERS; Infidelity Keeps Us Together

body: Catskill, N.Y. THE journey of 120 miles begins with a single stroke, but the Chinese philosopher Lao Tzu never swam in the mighty Hudson. David Barra peered over the edge of a pontoon boat drifting north in the steady current flowing past the Rip Van Winkle Bridge here. His friend, Janet Harris, had jumped in to swim south. Her arms slid deep into
title: Seven Days And 120 Miles To Go

body: The Coney Island Boardwalk, opened in 1923, has inspired songs (The Drifters' ''Under the Boardwalk''), plays (Herb Gardner's ''The Goodbye People'') and fiction (Delmore Schwartz's ''In Dreams Begin Responsibilities''). Now, it is inspiring a question of Talmudic complexity: Can a boardwalk be called a boardwalk if it is not made of boards? Last
title: A Fight Over Keeping Boards in the Boardwalk

body: Sarah Taylor Yarnall, a daughter of Elizabeth Taylor Yarnall and Gerard L. Yarnall of Yardley, Pa., was married there Saturday to William Ding Wah Tsang, the son of Wai Po Tsang and Sze Sim Tsang of Brooklyn. The Rev. Daniell C. Hamby performed the ceremony at St. Andrew's Episcopal Church, where he is rector. The bride, 26, and the bridegroom, 27,
title: Sarah Yarnall, William Tsang

body: Talk about the reverse of not in my backyard! You'd never know it from the looks of the swimming pool, back porches, patios, makeshift garage, basketball hoop, parking lot for five cars and other suburban amenities squatting in the middle of a square block in Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn, but they occupy a 20-foot-wide corridor that is officially a
title: Forgotten Railroad's Land Makes a Great Back Porch

body: Even as top Democrats intensified pressure on him to resign, Representative Anthony D. Weiner of New York tried to power through the day on Thursday and suggest things were getting back to normal. ''I'm going to go back to my community office and try to get some work done,'' he told a reporter before jumping into a waiting car in Manhattan. So far,
title: Brash Style Alienates Congressman From Peers

body: ON a sunny day, with a cool breeze blowing off the water and people sitting at sidewalk tables sipping tea from small glasses, Emmons Avenue in Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn, could almost be in Istanbul -- or even in the Ukrainian port city of Odessa. Which may explain why so many Turkish and Ukrainian immigrants have made themselves at home among the
title: LIVING IN | SHEEPSHEAD BAY, BROOKLYN; Calm and Clamor, in Equal Measure

body: HALPER--Marjorie, on May 12, 2011, age 85. Beloved wife of the late Dr. Herbert L. Halper. Loving mother of Dale Cernuda (Jay Stern) and Meredith Gindi (Jack) and stepmother of Dr. Mitchell Halper (Della), Dean Halper and Dr. Bradley Halper (Susan). Adoring grandmother of Jan, Bryan, Shaun, Ryan, Blake, Joseph, Alyssa, Jillian and Jared. Cherished
title: Paid Notice: Deaths HALPER, MARJORIE

title: Spare Times

author: Francine Prose's latest novel, ''My New American Life,'' will be published by HarperCollins in May.
body: IT'S been more than 40 years since I lived in the house, but every so often I wake up knowing I've been there in my sleep. Architectural elements -- a window, a porch, a staircase -- have made cameo appearances in several of my novels. I even started a novel in which a disturbed Raskolnikov type dreams of walking through the house, his long-lost
title: DOMESTIC LIVES; Revisiting a House of Nooks and Crannies

body: 'TO THE MOON' Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, isn't likely to replace Cape Canaveral as a permanent launching site for spacecraft. But on Monday it will serve as a blastoff point for several extraterrestrial adventures. They make up ''To the Moon: Short Films About Space Travel,'' the latest program in the Brooklyn series Big Movies for Little Kids. The
title: Spare Times: For Children

body: THEY are well-heeled warriors. These squash players do battle behind thick glass at the courts of the Yale Club, in Midtown Manhattan, backed by a soundtrack of roars and grunts and lunging bodies slamming against walls. On a recent weekday, one of the liveliest contests was on Court 2, where an older man was running a much younger player ragged
title: SWEAT; 92 Years Old, And Still Ruling The Squash Court

body: For nearly a quarter-century, Luis Arroyo, 61, has waxed and stripped the 275,000 square feet of floors at the MJHS's Menorah Center for Rehabilitation and Nursing Care in Manhattan Beach, Brooklyn. Mr. Arroyo lives with his wife of seven years in Kew Gardens, Queens. Provenance: Puerto Rico. I came here about 40 years ago. Trajectory: My first job
title: EXPERIENCE NECESSARY; Keeping Floors So Shiny You Fear to Tread
